Luiza de Melo Gomes

Belo Horizonte · Brazil · +55 (31) 9 8446 0510 · ludemelo5452@gmail.com

I'm a final-year undergrad who loves turning ideas into code. Whether it's tinkering with compilers, building cloud tools, or solving problems in Python, Java, or C, I thrive on hands-on projects, especially those that make a real impact. My internships and research have taught me that the best solutions come from curiosity and collaboration, and I'm always eager to learn (or debug!) my way to the next challenge.

Experience

Undergraduate Researcher

Compilers Laboratory

Developed a Verilog program synthesizer in C++ to generate test cases for the Jasper Formal Verification Platform by Cadence Design Systems and discovered 9 confirmed bugs in open source tools.

July 2024 - Present

Software Engineering Intern

dti digital

Enhanced a cloud-based insurance management platform by developing front-end components (Angular/TypeScript) and optimizing back-end services (Java/Oracle) on Microsoft Azure.

March 2024 - September 2024

Software Engineering Intern

Synergia

I was involved in the development and maintenance of the “Portal de Compras”, aimed at providing services related to the purchasing process in the state of Minas Gerais. I utilized Java in conjunction with React. My responsibilities included resolving bugs and conducting quality tests.

August 2023 - February 2024

Undergraduate Researcher

Departamento de Ciência da Computação - UFMG

I worked on the project “Prediction of Success in Different Industries”, researching common factors among successful individuals. To achieve this, I consumed the APIs of Spotify and Twitter and analyzed the collected data using Python.

October 2021 - April 2023

Interests

Apart from being a web developer, I enjoy most of my time being outdoors. I like to hang out with my friends, got to the cinema and visit museums.

When indoors, I play a lot of open-world games, such as Red Dead Redemption, GTA V and Cyberpunk. I also enjoy watching drama movies and TV shows.
